name: Royal Continental Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after staying in Naples previously we were pleased with the location and presentation of the hotel. We has a very spacious room opposite the fort/castle with beautiful views of the sea. Nearby there are lots of bars and resturants but we chose to eat in the hotel and we were really pleased with the food and the service, we would have said we would return to the hotel in the future until arriving home I found an expensive purse still in its box a present received on the holiday was missing. We had stayed in 3 hotels on the trip the RC being the last before flying home, I called and emailed all 3 hotels . The Royal Continental told me without hesitation I had not left it whilst all the other said whilst they had no record of housekeeping finding an item but they would check again. RC also ignored my follow up email. I then called again and had a long conversation with a young lady who did put me on hold and then confirmed the hotel did not have the purse. I was convinced that I had not opened the hand luggage which contained the purse during my stay so I asked if the hotel could they review the log of entries into the room using my stay and which key had been used, the debate became heated and i was told to email the director. I did and did not receive a reply again. When I mailed for the 3rd time and asked them to support my enquiry i finally received a mail back to say they had my purse. I had to organise the courier and I finally have it back it cost me £30 and it remains a mystery to what happened you decide !
reviews.title: sour after taste
Good base to explore Naples.
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights following 3 nights in Sorrento. We walked to the hotel from the ferry port with our cases, which took approx 15 minutes and we found the hotel easily enough.

reviews.title: Nice view
reviews.text: The location is great and is situated on a road which comes alive at night, once the sun goes down and the temperature cools, the street is awash with people. The restaurants are all packed and people walk, run or cycle up and down the road. It has a great atmosphere and is clearly the 'tourist hotspot' in Naples. There is also a small cluster of restaurants and bars behind the Castell Dell Ovo, which again has a wonderful atmosphere and great seafood eateries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is decent enough and we found the staff friendly and helpful, they helped us with locating buses and advised which buses we needed to catch to get to various places. The pool area on the roof is basic and not the most beautiful pool area I've ever seen, but it does the job and is a great sun trap - be warned however, the bar prices there are steep, I ordered 2 cans of Sprite and was charged €10. I gracefully declined and cancelled my order.
reviews.title: Great Views but Check What you are Paying for.

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine, with the usual continental style options plus scrambled eggs and some bacon and sausage type options, but to be honest they didn't look too appetising.
reviews.title: Great Place to Relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for just one night: we needed a central location in order to make the best out of the available time we had, and we definitely could. All the most famous points of interest are walkable, for instance a ten-minute-walk will take you to Piazza del Plebiscito, which is great.
reviews.title: Excellent location, friendly staff, but the rooms need a restyling!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff courteous and professional. Everyone speaks perfect English (I'm Italian, but my husband prefers to communicate in English and he had no issues whatsoever with the staff, which is not the norm, in some parts of Italy).
reviews.title: A beautiful setting and luxurious hotel

reviews.text: I found the breakfast buffet pretty good, offering both international and local specialities (such as lovely mini sfogliatelle, the traditional pastries). You will be served hot drinks at the table. Rosa was lovely and made sure we got everything we needed. The view on Castel dell'Ovo is simply breathtaking!
reviews.title: Great hotel to use as a base.

reviews.text: The only slightly negative thing I would like to point out is that the rooms are very dated and could do with some restyling. The bathroom looked so old and boring! The bed was fairly comfortable.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Naples with a family

reviews.text: All in all, a good stay and I can surely recommend this hotel for a brief city break.
reviews.title: Not a bad hotel

reviews.text: It all works, from the reception to the housekeeping, to the barman, and the view is priceless.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located and close to downtown, and there are restaurants everywhere, so you can always find something for everyone.
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.text: The service at the hotel is good, they are all very friendly both at reception and in the restaurant where you get a great breakfast buffet each morning. If I have to say one thing, it seemed to me that they need to renovate the rooms, especially the carpet. The carpet in our room 541 was not so lucky this time, I will be sad if I get such a room again. Otherwise, I have nothing negative to say. :-)
reviews.title: Trip to Naples and the Amalfi Coast

reviews.text: We visited Naples in July 2013. The hotel felt a little dated however the cleanliness of the room was exceptional, the air conditioning worked perfectly (to our relief - it was hot!) and the view from the breakfast area of Castel dell'Ovo was very impressive. We did not get chance to try the roof top pool as unfortunately it does not open until 11am. However it looked very nice with fantastic views over the bay.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are restaurants nearby along the waterfront but we found these to be of poor quality. We preferred the restaurants on the nearby Via Santa Lucia. The port for boats to Sorrento and Capri is approx 15 mins walk along the waterfront. The train station is too far to walk but fixed price rate for a taxi is 13 Euros. So a nice balance between waterfront views and accessibility to places further afield.
reviews.title: Great Views

description: The Royal Continental hotel on Naples’ seafront promenade is both elegant and functional and replies to the needs of even the most demanding guest offering a comfortable and appeal setting for both business and leisure travellers. The meticulous attention paid to every detail of its innovative style and design make this property even more welcoming and sunny. The furnishings were created by the interior designer par excellence Gio Ponti, a master of modern 20th-century Italian architecture. The hotel has been entirely renovated and restyled; contemporary tastes blend with its natural elegance and spontaneity and with the refined mix of colours and sinuous but symmetrical shapes to create an ambience which is the epitome of hospitality.
